inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: complaining of dissatisfaction with her body shape

inclusion.criterion: does not smoke or use drugs
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She doesn't smoke or use any drugs

inclusion.criterion: completed the four square step test in 14 seconds
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She completed the four square step test in 14 seconds

inclusion.criterion: parturient will be randomized as to whether her companion will be allowed in the room or will be asked to leave
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: After all these data have been collected, the parturient will be randomized...

exclusion.criterion: receiving neuraxial anesthesia for a cesarean delivery
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: begin to push for delivery before completion of the STAI questionnaire following labor epidural catheter placement
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: no support person present at the time of the neuraxial procedure
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: ASA 3 or greater, or if they have a contraindication to receiving any of the medications routinely used in the placement of a labor epidural catheter (lidocaine, bupivacaine, epinephrine, fentanyl)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Adults who are unable to consent and minors will be excluded
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 32-year-old obese woman with sleep apnea, PCO, and dissatisfaction with her body shape. She has no prior pregnancies and does not smoke or use drugs.
